New Records: The San Diego Padres became the first team in MLB postseason history to get six consecutive hits and hit for the cycle in the same inning.
Key Match Events: The Padres scored 5 runs in the second inning, taking a 5-1 lead over the Atlanta Braves.
Marcell Ozuna scored a run for the Braves in the top of the first inning.
Michael Harris II hit a two-run home run for the Braves in the fifth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves replaced Max Fried with Dylan Lee, Daysbel Hernández, Pierce Johnson and Joe Jiménez after the disastrous second inning due to a hip injury suffered by Fried.
